top_categories.workout_context: Niseko Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Niseko Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Niseko Gravel’s hokkaido mountains, japanese gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Niseko Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Niseko Gravel’s hokkaido mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Niseko Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Niseko Gravel’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Niseko Gravel’s hokkaido mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Niseko Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Niseko Gravel’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Niseko Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on hokkaido mountain gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Niseko Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Niseko Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Niseko Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Niseko Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on hokkaido mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: hokkaido mountains, japanese gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 65 miles of hokkaido mountain gravel in Niseko, Hokkaido, Japan.
